humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " words " and " forbearance ", the original meaning is recognition and identification. "Yu Pian‧ Yan Bu": "Acknowledge, know also." "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Zhuo Mao Biography": "Taste of time, some people recognize his horse."

" Recognition " can be expressed recognition. "Zhou Shu‧ Yuwen Biography": "The prefectures and counties captured the thief, and all the property was obtained. If you fear that the thief will sit and die, you will not admit it. Then you will be pardoned."

" Acknowledgement " can also mean to think and see. One of Song Liu Kezhuang's "Answers to Brother Lin Gongyu": "Mreating back to the waning moon, I mistakenly believed that it was dawn."

" Acknowledge " also means remembering. Song Liu Chenweng "Mo Yu'er": "Peach Blossom in front of the door, Liu Lang can remember, can Hua Fu recognize Lang?"

humanum_full_description:
從「言」，「忍」聲，本義為識別、辨明。《玉篇‧言部》：「認，認識也。」《後漢書‧卓茂傳》：「時嘗出行，有人認其馬。」

　　「認」可表示承認。《周書‧宇文測傳》：「州縣擒盜，并物俱獲。測恐此盜坐之以死，乃不認焉。遂遇赦得免。」

　　「認」還可表示認為、看作。宋劉克莊〈答婦兄林公遇〉之一：「夢回殘月在，錯認是天明。」

　　「認」也表示記得。宋劉辰翁〈摸魚兒〉：「門前度桃花，劉郎能記，花復認郎否？」

(1)认识；辨别。

(3)引申为把本无某种亲密关系的人看作有某种亲密关系。

(10)用同“仍”。沿袭。参见“認舊”。

Meaning Mnemonic
What people say to you will be carved by a blade into your heart, and the next time you see them, you'll immediately recognize them.
Sometimes your brain won't recognize someone, but your heart will. That's because what they say draws that blade across your heart and leaves a mark, for better or for worse, forever.

There's just something about Nintendo—you'd recognize them and their games anywhere.
